divs: Sighting DetailsMy wife, daughter, son, mom, and I were trick or treating in a large group when around 6:30-7:00 a woman in our pack said "Oh, how pretty a shooting star." I looked up and saw a solid and stright bright silver line or ribbon.(the only way I can explain it) I said to the woman, "that's no shooting star." From where I was standing (obviously on the ground), if I measured it with extended arms, it was probably about 3 feet long and 1 foot thick. We watched it for about 1-2 minutes and then it just faded. We continued trick or treating, but I keopt looking at the sky hoping to see it again. Approximately 20 minutes later we ALL saw a orangish - red orb moving with no sound and swiftly from the south to north. It almost looked on fire. I can not tell you how high it was flying, but It was more than just a light. I could actually make out the shape and it was an orb. It appeared to be solid on the top and bottom, and the light came from the middle. I have never seen anything like it. I tried to capture its image on my cell phone, but I could not get it to function. We watched it go and then fade away. I was not a believer in UFOs, but that night changed my mind. I began to watch UFO hunters and sure enough another sighting that occured on Oct. 31st happened in Tinley Park a few years ago. I was really confused for a few days, but came to realize that yes I had indeed seen an Unidentified Flying Object.
trends: There have been 2 other sightings in Wauconda
There were no other sightings in Wauconda on or around October 31st 2008
